content:
Diagnosis:	Basal cell carcinoma right temple, T3 with local invasion

Management:	15 Mar 2024 Initial surgical excision with positive margins
		02 Apr 2024 Started radiotherapy

Current Situation:	Week 3 of radiotherapy treatment

I reviewed [redacted name] today during radiotherapy treatment. The right temple surgical site shows expected radiation changes with moderate erythema and mild desquamation. There is no evidence of infection or bleeding. The patient reports mild local discomfort managed well with regular paracetamol. No systemic symptoms reported.

The radiotherapy team confirms good treatment compliance with 12 of 20 fractions completed. Treatment tolerance remains satisfactory with only grade 1 skin toxicity. The surgical site appears to be responding appropriately to treatment with reducing induration at the margins.

Plan is to complete the remaining fractions as scheduled. Will review again in clinic 4 weeks after completion of radiotherapy for wound assessment and consideration of follow-up imaging. Patient understands to contact if any concerns in the interim.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: basal cell carcinoma with positive margins

cancer_timeline.value: Initial surgical excision with positive margins
12 of 20 fractions completed with good compliance

patient_facts.value: Right temple surgical site shows moderate erythema and mild desquamation
Mild local discomfort managed with regular paracetamol

status_updates.value: T3 basal cell carcinoma right temple post surgical excision, currently receiving radiotherapy with good response
Grade 1 skin toxicity with moderate erythema and mild desquamation
Reducing induration at surgical margins suggesting appropriate response to treatment
Continuing radiotherapy as planned, 12 of 20 fractions completed
Review in clinic 4 weeks after completion of radiotherapy
Consideration of follow-up imaging at next review
